fields.description: see attached image
fields.summary: Dashboard layout is broken
Table wiki markup not working

fields.description:
After setting up my first project, the home page reads:

"This is the home page for 'TEST' space."

The single quote chars have been converted to (ampersand)apos; which is not a valid HTML entity (although it is a valid XML entity). This is not recognised by IE6 or Opera6 on windows. 

Maybe specifying a doctype will fix this?
fields.summary: ' on home page not rendered in IE6

fields.description: At the moment you cannot create a page called "What?".
fields.summary: Cannot create a page with a ? in the name

fields.description:
There is a bug when rendering text like this:

*page* and *space* in that the whole string is bolded (the ' and ' included). It should only be the outside words which are bolded right?

Looks like it's being too greedy at the moment.
fields.summary: Rendering bug with bold (possibly all phrases)

fields.description:
They should work like JIRA listeners, except responding to different events. PageListener, SpaceListener and ConfluenceListener (user events etc) sound like a good place to start for interfaces.

See also CONF-193 for details on how they would be installed/removed.
fields.summary: Confluence listeners

fields.description: Useful for creating pages automatically, or sync'ing pages between installations.
fields.summary: XML import/export of a single page

fields.description:
Similar to CONF-197 but this report would show the pages which are never linked to (ie have content but no way to get to them). 

Again, filterable per space or all viewable spaces.
fields.summary: Report: orphaned pages

fields.description:
Show a list of all pages which are linked to from other pages, but not defined.

This report could be across all viewable spaces, or for a particular space.
fields.summary: Report: undefined pages

fields.description: A history link like in JIRA (top right) that shows the user their recent pages browsed. This is very useful when flicking back and forth between multiple pages.
fields.summary: Personal history

fields.description:
Interwiki links are really useful and we use them for linking between different spaces at the moment. 

We should enable the user to specify a prefix and URL (ie "google", "http://www.google.com/search?q=$1" ). This would enable the user to add services that they want themselves and use them as simple interwiki links.

Examples of usage:
* [google:jira] to link to a google search for JIRA
* [jdk:java.lang.String] to link to the JDK docs for String
* [intranet:pbennett] to link to the intranet page for pbennett.
fields.summary: Generic Interwiki Links

fields.description:
A full screen calendar (presumably one month at a time) showing the pages created/updated on any given date. This list should be filterable (all spaces / particular space etc).

See mike for more details on how this should work.
fields.summary: Calendar of events

fields.description:
Like JIRA services for Confluence. The ability to periodically run code within Confluence.

Initial services we'll need are JellyService (run some Jelly periodically), PopMailService (to read in POP mail boxes), FileMailService (to read mail messages off disk), FileService (to read in files and do something with them).

Services should be installed and uninstalled. This is just the 'installation' based on a class file (ie make sure it's in the classpath and record it in a list of available services).

The user can then create an instance of any available service, with a period (how often it is updated) and any particular parameters that that service has.
fields.summary: Confluence services

fields.description:
(from Nick Minutello)

I think that you want to treat attachments as snips - ie you may want to link to the same attachment from different pages. ala [attachment:namespace:UserInstructions.doc]. You may want to add some metadata to the attachment that you could display in a tool-tip).
fields.summary: Ability to link to attachments

fields.description:
(another bizarre idea from Nick Minutello - needs more thinking I think)

In addition to macro registration (config params) that I mentioned previously, you should also be able to configure the macro to listen in on certain types of events (ie the macro chooses how to handle these events). The particular example would be the menu above - you wouldnt want it to generate the menu HTML it each time the page containing it is rendered, but rather cache and only clear the cache on create/edit snip events.
fields.summary: Allow macros to listen for system events

fields.description:
(via Nick Minutello)

It would also be very useful is to be able to set user-defined metadata for a given snip/page. This metadata could added to the indexing for full-text search. It could also  be used to drive generation of hierarchical navigation tree (cross-space).

Something along the lines of:

Defining  Menu (perhaps as macro-registration config):

<Menu category="type" values="Documentation" render="html">    <!-- defines
specific menu -- >
      <!-- will resolve to all categories with type of documentation, and
category values for "product" -- >
      <Menu category="product" values="*" render="dhtml">
            <Menu  category="Services" values="Services*" render="dhtml"/>
<!-- will resolve to any snip with categories matching hierarchy -->
      </MenuList>
</Menu>

Could give either a static hml (or even DHTML) navigation menu
Documentation->
      Jira ->
            Services ->
                  Backup Service
                  POP Service
      Confluence ->
            Services ->
                  RSS Service

This means that you can have live navigation (ie add a new snip, it automatically appears in the nav under the correct categories). It also means you could access the same snip under different category navigation directions (when it rightly satisfies both categorisations).

Even cooler would then be the next step of auto-generation of categorisation metadata from the snip/page contents (if you happened to have some natural language (bayesian) means of categorisation - ala Autonomy)
fields.summary: Page Meta Data

${confluence.home}/attachments

fields.description:
Links to other pages (not in the exported document) should still be links to the page online. 
For example when exporting http://confluence.atlassian.com:10090/display/CONF/test+page the link to [Home] should still be there, just linked to the server where the document was created from. If both pages are exported, the links should be between pages. Can we do that? It'd be awesome.

This "WebLogic 7.0 Support - JIRA should now work on WebLogic 7.0 out-of-the-box;" is displayed as this:

"WebLogic? 7.0 Support - JIRA should now work with BEA WebLogic? Server 7.0 outof-thebox"


So seeing unecessary hyperlinking and unwanted strike through.

Also apostrophes are messing up:

"haven't" rather than "haven't"
fields.summary: Apostrophe's In Text

fields.description:
Each space should be able to have lots of notification schemes, and users should have customisable notification preferences per space, and possibly per page.

Also email content could be customisable (wiki format for HTML email?) per space.
fields.summary: Notification schemes with customisable email

fields.description:
Each space should have an editable decorator. This would allow you to make each space look different.

We would need to make macros to show the standard navigation elements, breadcrumbs, search box etc - but those macros could just call velocity includes I think.
fields.summary: Remote editable space decorators

fields.description:
The view profile screen is ugly at the moment.

- It should have a large text area to enable you to post information about yourself (wiki-formatted of course). 
- It should have a list of the pages that the user has recently added and edited (that the 'viewer' can see of course)
- Number of pages that the user has authored
- Date the user signed up
- Date the user last logged in
- Spaces the user has created that you can see

I'll add other thoughts here as I think of them.
fields.summary: Improve view profile screen

fields.description:
Create a list of each user's favourite pages.

On each page they can click 'Add to my favourites', and then the list of their favourite pages shows up on their dashboard.

On the dashboard they can also click 'remove from my favourites' to remove a page from their favourites list.
fields.summary: Favourite pages

fields.description:
Currently, you are allowed to add two template pages with the same name. 

As a consequence, if you attempt to add a new page, the template dropdown only displays the first of the two identically named templates.

As an aside, template description is currently not used or displayed anywhere. Maybe we need to find a place to display it or get rid of it.
fields.summary: Add template page should enforce unique template names

fields.description:
Re-editing should not save the user's changes. 

Currently the re-edit button functions just like the "confirm" button. 

This is however working fine for a newly added template.

1. view home page
2. Select "add page", but cancel it. 
3. Template operations should appear on the right (??? why is that ???)
4. Creating a template with these links will not get displayed when you select the "TEMPLATES" link on the top right nav bar.

fields.description:
1. Setup Paths/backup page
The backup directory is where backup (remove) Confluence will places its daily data backups. Either specify a path relative to Confluence home, or an absolute path. If you leave this field empty, no daily backups will be made (remove from you or for you?) from you. 

2. Confluence setup (mail setup)
- Please select (the) mechanism Confluence should use for sending notification emails.

3. Confluence Administrator setup
- Please configure the administrator account for this Confluence instalation (installation). 

4. Edit groups
- User is not a member of any groups. (remove the plural)
(must first remove the user from all groups)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Renaming the attachment by adding backlash will cause the preview to fail with an error.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and attach a file to it 
 # Publish the page and go to the Attachments section (... > Attachments);
# Here you'll see the attached file, and on the right-hand side click on Properties
# Rename the file name by adding \ or /

h3. Expected Results

Users are able to view the attachment without an error.

h3. Actual Results
 !Screenshot 2022-01-05 at 12.55.17.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Remove the \ or / from the name
fields.summary: Attachment preview failing if the attachment contain backlash

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users who do not have permission to comment on a page still have the option to leave an internal comment. However, when attempting to leave a comment, they encounter the following error message:
{quote}You can’t create comments in this space. A space admin can modify your permissions.
{quote}
!error-message.png|width=163,height=153!
h3. Suggested Solution

This is not user-friendly. The request is if the user doesn't have permission to comment, Confluence shouldn't show the *COMMENT* module when they select text.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Hide ability to leave an inline comment from users without comment permissions

fields.description:
Whenever one tries to open a Confluence page that only users with a whitelisted IP can access, one gets a generic error like this:

!image-2022-01-04-09-25-05-598.png|width=333,height=224!

Any chance the error message could be changed in such instances to say something along the lines of “Your IP is not authorised to view this content?” Anytime me or my colleagues forget to turn on our VPN we think that the whole Confluence server is down.
fields.summary: Better error message for accessing content through an unauthorised IP

fields.description: In light of [HOT-97752|https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HOT-97752], we want to add some integration tests around feedback form submissions. These integration test(s) should ensure that the feedback form submission flow works from request to submission.
fields.summary: Add integration tests for testing feedback form submissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since the beginning of this year 2022, all notifications (even the ones from the last days of 2021, ie, December 2021) are showing as "1 year ago"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the notification (bell) icon on the right-hand top corner on the cloud site.
 # Scroll down to the notifications from 2021


h3. Expected Results

Even though the year has changed, confluence should take days and months into account as well.
h3. Actual Results

All notifications from 2021 are showing 1 year ago.

h3. Update

This also affects Jira Cloud.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: All notifications are showing as "1 year ago" since January 1st, 2022

fields.description:
Currently, It is not possible to insert Unicode characters in the expend macro title, If we copy and paste the Unicode characters(🔌 🛠️ 📊 🔎 🕹️ 🔳) in the new editor expend macro title, Unicode characters are not visible post publishing the page.

Before publishing the page:
 !image-2022-01-03-12-03-49-489.png|thumbnail! 

Post publishing the page:
 !image-2022-01-03-12-04-14-713.png|thumbnail! 

These chares are still working in expand macros title
⚠️️️️️️⚙️
fields.summary: Ability to use Unicode characters in new editor expend macro title

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, normal text has the color #172b4d while links have #0052CC which represents a 2.06:1 contrast ratio, but color contrast ratio between links and surrounding text needs to be at least 3:1 in order to be accessible to people with low vision or color blindness.

h3. Suggested Solution
Increase the contrast between normal text and links to 3:1 or more.
fields.summary: Higher contrast between normal text and links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This is an accessibility bug, as when the user clicks a table of content link or any other anchor link, the visual focus goes to the anchor, but the keyboard focus remains in the link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a big page with text and headings
 # Insert a TOC (table of contents) macro
 # Publish the page and click one of the TOC links
 # Try to navigate using the keyboard

h3. Expected Results
The keyboard focus should be changed to the same place as the visual focus

h3. Actual Results
The keyboard focus will remain at the link


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking an anchor or table of content link won't move the keyboard focus

fields.description:
In early Q1, Shadow Health will migrate from Google Suite to Elsevier 0365 and Sharepoint. As a part of that migration, SH has files stored on Google Drive that will all move to Sharepoint.

Additionally SH has its own Confluence instance (https://shadow.atlassian.net). (This will be migrated to the Elsevier stack in April 2022) In the current Confluence instance there are links to files in google drive.

These links need to updated to point to the new Sharepoint location once the files are migrated.

Currently we are faced with updating these links manually which is not ideal for a variety of easy-to-imagine reasons.

We are looking for possible solutions or ideas on how we could automate the updating of the links. Can you help us automate this? Thank you
fields.summary: Facilitating a necessary services migration

fields.description:
Hello!

It would be great to have a possibility to write text in Confluence table in a vertical direction.
fields.summary: direction of text in a table

fields.description:
In the current "Attachment" macro, the default position of the "file browser/uploader" is below the File List table.
I couldn't see an option to align/re-position the "file browser/uploader". Also it will be helpful if we have "Table" properties carried to this "File List". e.g. Filter/search/column width adjustments
fields.summary: Option to re-position "file browser" in "Attachment" macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sorting functionality is not available in Column headers of the Page Properties Report macro table in view mode. 
Note: The sorting functionality in the column header was working before.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a page properties report macro populated with a few rows.
 # Publish the page.
 # Now try to sort the columns using the table header on Page Properties Report table. 

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to manually click the column header once the report has been generated to sort the table in view mode.

h3. Actual Results
The sorting option is not present for the column header

h3. Workaround
Use the "Sort by" function available in the macro in edit mode.
fields.summary: Sorting functionality not available for column headers in Page Properties Report table in view mode

fields.description: Create a fast forward pipeline which would deploy to the import shard on a scheduled basis
fields.summary: Create deployment pipeline for import shard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new space, it uses the Default Space Content from the global template in Confluence Settings, which is on the Editor (aka new editor).
The spaces are being created with its Overview page in the legacy editing experience, disregarding if the instance has only the Editor or both Editors.
Additionally, it happens even if the global template is edited or not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space;
 # Check the Overview page
 # Edit the overview page of this space

h3. Expected Results

This page is on the new editing experience
h3. Actual Results

The page is on the legacy editing experience. The global template though is showing the Editor (new) when you edit it.
h3. Workaround

Create a new page in the space and change it to be the new overview one.
fields.summary: Creating a new space has Overview page in the legacy editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users try to create a Jira issue from highlighting text on a Confluence Page, users receive this "Unable to get a list of linked Jira servers from Confluence. You may want to check your application links for more details" message
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Confluence page
 # Highlight a part of the text and select *Create issue*
*!Screen Shot 2021-12-22 at 15.28.45.png!*

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to create the Jira issue
h3. Actual Results

The user receives an error message:

!Screen Shot 2021-12-22 at 15.27.32.png|width=194,height=112!
{noformat}
Unable to get a list of linked Jira servers from Confluence. You may want to check your application links for more details {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Cannot create Jira issue from text on Confluence Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page Properties Report macro "Label" filter does not show recently labeled pages. but it seems to work after a few hours.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a new page with page property macro and add a new/existing label
 # create another page, add the page property reports macro 
 # filter the add the page property reports macro  with Label 
 # add the new/existing label in the filter, the recently created page does not show up.

h3. Expected Results

The filter "label" should show newly created pages tagged with the specific label, as before
h3. Actual Results

The page property reports macro with filter "label" does not show newly created pages tagged with labels.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro "Label" filter does not show recently labeled pages

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Ability to restore deleted Calendars.

h3. Description
Sometimes users delete calendars by accident. It would be great to have a feature where deleted calendars can be restored.
fields.summary: Ability to restore deleted Calendars

fields.description:
Ability to Raise a Bug from Help (?) Menu.

Raise a Bug shortcut is available in Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to Raise a Bug from Help (?) Menu

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The hyperlink is not retained when copying a hyperlinked text from an excel sheet cell into a confluence page when published. The hyperlink is seen in the edit mode but when published hyperlinks seem to be lost.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy a cell in an MS Excel file that contains any hyperlinked text.
 # Paste the copied hyperlinked text into a confluence page and publish it.

h3. Expected Results

The confluence page when published should retain the link with the text.
h3. Actual Results

The confluence page only displays the plain text when published. The hyperlink is lost.
h3. Workaround

Paste the direct link/URL into the table as the URL is converted to a Smart Link. You can decide if you'd like it to be shown as an actual {*}URL{*}, {*}inline{*}, {*}card{*}, {*}embed{*}.
fields.summary: Hyperlink is not retained when copying a hyperlinked text from an excel sheet cell

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Under certain circumstances spaces creation can fail leaving the space key unusable.

While this is not a common issue, we have seen it happening in the case of incidents like the following:
- https://developer.status.atlassian.com/incidents/9c9n8zvkq1d1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # N/A

h3. Expected Results
The space creation always work or fails without leaving the space key unusable.

h3. Actual Results
The space creation fails but the space key cannot be used again and the request fails with {{A space already exists with key <spaceKey>}} even if the space is not available.

h3. Workaround
Affected customers can reach out to the Atlassian Customer support team to remove the unusable spaces via the form at https://support.atlassian.com/contact.
fields.summary: Under certain circumstances spaces creation can fail leaving the space key unusable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Medium Priority AI (Automate the deployment for Splunk Shard) for https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/PIR-10949

Splunk is on it's own dedicated shard and we need to automate the deployment for Splunk to keep it up to date. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

N/A
h3. Expected Results

N/A
h3. Actual Results

N/A
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automate deployment for import shard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create from template macro does not work on Confluence Mobile on Android Devices.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence Page with a *create from template page macro* and configure it to use any global template.
 # One a Android device through the mobile app navigate to this page.
 # Click on the *create from template button*
 # Nothing will happen

h3. Expected Results

It should load a new page with the template.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. As seen in this support generated video: [^WhatsApp Video 2021-12-20 at 1.48.38 PM.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Use the Mobile Web Browser to create a page from template page macro.
fields.summary: Create from template macro does not work on Confluence Mobile on Android Devices.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have an inline comment on a Confluence Page. Then copy and paste the text onto a Google Doc or Gmail email the text that was highlighted on Confluence will still appear highlighted on the Google Doc. However the inline comment will not appear. If the inline comment is not copy/pasted then the highlighted text shouldn't be copy/pasted either.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Confluence Page
 # Create a paragraph
 # Add an inline comment on a couple words.
 # Copy the entire page
 # Paste into a Google Doc
 # The text will appear highlighted by not with the inline comment.

h3. Expected Results

The text should not appear highlighted as the inline comment isn't being transferred.
h3. Actual Results

The text is appearing highlighted without the inline comment.
fields.summary: Inline Comment Highlight should not be copy and pasted into 3rd party apps

fields.description: Currently, if a page made as space homepage the space name will be shown on the page instead of the original page title.
fields.summary: Show page title instead of space name when page made as space homepage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We can't enter Japanese text properly when publishing the meeting notes in Microsoft Teams App. Japanese customer can't search the appropriate space neme due to this bug (please see the attached video).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Launch the Teams app and start the meeting
 # Take the note with [Confluence|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-microsoft-teams-and-confluence-together/] feature
 # Click the Publish button
 # Switch to Japanese IME and type "tesuto" in text box

h3. Expected Results
"てすと" will be shown

h3. Actual Results
"tえsうtお" will be shown
 [^AtlassianSupport 2021-12-20 at 14.29.52.mov] 

h3. Workaround
Copy the string "てすと" in advance and paste it into the text box
fields.summary: Unable to enter Japanese properly when publishing the meeting notes in Microsoft Teams App

fields.description: When I highlight all the content in a panel or expand, the whole macro is deleted. Prevent the whole macro from deleting and delete only the text/content, leaving the macro in place please.
fields.summary: Don't delete a panel or expand macro when all the text is selected and deleted

fields.description:
*User story:*

As a project manager using confluence for meeting notes & actions

I would like the task report macro to include an option for "current page", similar to the option for "current space"

So I can use the task macro to view actions for the meeting notes page I'm working on

*Additional information:*

GIVEN: Task macro doesn't have pagination

WHEN: I try to search for the page I'm working on to add it to the macro

AND: I'm using a blueprint with a defined name

THEN: I receive a limited number of result with similar names

AND: The page I'm working on is not included in the list

!image-2021-12-17-12-02-21-148.png!

!image-2021-12-17-12-09-55-083.png!
fields.summary: Task Report - add feature for "this page"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tasks report macro next page /second page shows empty report when set to show only 10 tasks per page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create 40+ tasks on your space, insert task report macro on a page to show all tasks from the space or pages.
 # Step 2 Set 10 (number of tasks) per page to show 10 tasks on each page.
 # Step 3 Publish the page and try to click on the next page(2).

h3. Expected Results
It should show the tasks on the second page.

h3. Actual Results
It shows empty tasks report on the next page.


h3. Workaround
Set 30-40 (number of) tasks per page.
fields.summary: Task report macro next/second page 2 is empty when set to show only 10 tasks per page

fields.description:
Summary
When trying to export a Confluence page to PDF, the *Lithuanian characters are not visible in export*  

Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page full of *Lithuanian characters like  ąčęėįšųūž* 
# Publish it and export to PDF on the page
# Download it and view it from PDF viewer
# Noticed that *Lithuanian* is not showing the PDF file


Expected Results
*Lithuanian characters should be visible in pdf* 

Actual Results
Text with *Lithuanian* is not showing on the page


Workaround
The only workaround would be to use the Print button for example in Chrome and save the page as PDF. or use custom font.
fields.summary: Export to PDF in Lithuanian characters are not visible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Live search 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a search with the "Livesearch" macro on a page and put a keyword on the *Restrict to label(s)* filter.
 # Save the macro and publish the page.
 # Now search a keyword in macro and it will search pages based on label restrictions.
 # Hit *Enter* button and now search results will ignore/remove the "label" filter for search results.

h3. Expected Results
Search results should be based on "Restrict to label(s)"
h3. Actual Results
After hitting the *Enter* button, the search doesn't apply "Restrict to label(s)" for results.

h3. Workaround
Do not hit the *Enter* button during the search and select the pages from search results.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro doesn't apply "Restrict to label(s)" after hitting enter for search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Copying line breaks from a Google Doc into a Confluence Page creates 2 line breaks. It seems that a line break is stored in Google Doc as  {code:java}
{code} So when pasted into Confluence on it's own line it becomes  {code:java}


{code} Which creates 2 line breaks. This results in having the customer manually delete the additional line. This happens in the *new editor* and {*}legacy editor{*}. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a multiple page google doc text file, include new paragraph with a line break in between them. # Copy content # Paste into Confluence Page # You'll see on the line breaks the HTML tag *


* h3. Expected Results Only a single line break should be placed into the body of the page. h3. Actual Results 2 line breaks are created. Basically it seems like the HTML has a line break nested within a paragraph tag. h3. Workaround Manually delete the additional line breaks.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting line breaks from a Google Doc into a Confluence Page creates 2 line breaks
Specific field for page restriction status in Confluence API endpoints

fields.description: If I select some text that is formatted as Code in Confluence the 'Comment' option is disabled. I often would like to add comments to code blocks.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud: Allow commenting on Code Blocks
Update links when copying single pages to a new space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The icon for clearing the search box lost its transparent background.

This is only visible if the background has a different color than the default white color.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to enter a keyword in the search box with the default background color i.e., white color. It would be shown like below:
!image-2021-12-15-17-43-56-828.png!
 # Now change the background color to a different color, by navigating to *Settings* -> *Look and Feel* -> *Color Scheme.*
 # Once changed the background color, try searching any keyboard in the search box.
 # It loses the transparent background and would show like below:
!image-2021-12-15-17-43-04-883.png!

h3. Expected Results

The icon for clearing the search box should show transparent background like the default white color.
h3. Actual Results

It displays the clear button icon without transparent background.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour.
fields.summary: Clear button icon in the search box lost its transparent background

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After migration, users are unable to add files to the attachments macro. An HTTP error is being shown instead
h3. Steps to Reproduce

For a migrated space (or a copy of that space)
 # On a page with existing attachments macro, add a new attachment from the view page
 # Alternatively drag a file to upload it to the attachment macro

For a page created with the legacy editor template: 
 # Create and publish a page with attachments macro
 # Drag and drop new attachment into attachments macro dropzone

For a new (fabric) editor page:
 # Create a new page and add an attachments macro
 # Publish the page, wait until the view page screen is show.
 # Immediately perform a drag-and-drop upload to the attachments macro (without refreshing or navigating away from the page)

h3. Expected Results

The file is uploaded and attached to the macro.
h3. Actual Results

User sees an HTTP error:   !Screen Shot 2021-12-14 at 4.19.20 PM.png|width=328,height=222!

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
{"statusCode":404,"data":{"authorized":false,"valid":true,"errors":[],"successful":false},"message":"com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.NotFoundException: No content property found with key: editor"} {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attaching a file to an existing page with the attachments macro causes an HTTP error

fields.description: The Confluence Cloud Analytics has some great features, such as providing insights about how active your users are and which pages are viewed the most. My suggestion would be the capability to see which pages a user has visited when clicking on it from the Analytics page.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud Analytics - see which pages a user has visited

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Option to filter results by modification and creation date in Blog post Macro.
h3. Suggestion

At this time, blog post macro only has the option to sort results either by the creation or modification date. There is no functionality to filter the results based on such dates. 
Such a feature will be helpful for our customers.
fields.summary: Option to filter results by modification and creation date in Blog post Macro

fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, when a page is inheriting restrictions from a parent page, if it gets archived, it will no longer have any restrictions implemented into it. From the [archiving pages article|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/archive-pages/], the following is shared:

{quote}
Before archiving a page, be sure to check if it has inherited permissions. If it does, then the page is relying on one of its parent pages to control who can view and you might be exposing it to a wider audience by archiving it. To avoid this, set view restrictions on the page you’re archiving.
{quote}

h3.Suggestion

As the child page might become exposed to anyone that views the Archived pages within the space, this is a suggestion to automatically apply the parent page's restriction into the child page once it gets archived, avoiding it to be visible and extra efforts to restrict it again.
fields.summary: Keep inherited restrictions when archiving pages

fields.description:
I'm current using Confluence to write a policy, people don't like reading policies and I want to improve the accessibility.

There is currently an option to add files and I can upload sound files but it takes you to a different screen to view the file and it looks bulky.

The option to add a speaker / sound icon which when clicked plays a sound file would be great.  

Further to that you could add a sound time elapsed bar so people and rewind rather than listening to the whole sound file / section.

To improve this further, the ability to control the speed at which a sound file is played would be great.
fields.summary: FEATURE REQUEST | CONFLUENCE | UPLOAD AND PLAY AUDIO FILES

fields.description:
In our context it should not be possible to see the *names* of users who have viewed content in our site, we need to minimise the amount of personally identifiable information that is collected and displayed. 

In your documentation I find that for data center you have an option to enable an increased privacy mode for the analytics app. However, I cannot find this for Confluence Cloud.

Therefore, my suggestion is to implement this option for Confluence Cloud, too.
fields.summary: Confluence Clout Analytics - provide Increased privacy mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Values for columns "{*}labels{*}", "{*}Labelled{*}", "{*}Label List{*}", "{*}Watches{*}", "{*}Watching{*}" are not updated in Contributors summary macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step: Create and publish one or two pages with a label (e.g. 'contributors'), add as a watcher.
 # Step: Create another page and add a macro "Contributors Summary" to it with columns to display as "labels", "Labelled", "Label List", "Watches", "Watching".

h3. Expected Results

Contributors summary macro to display the values for the above columns.
h3. Actual Results

Contributors summary macro would only display the values for the other columns but not for the above-listed columns.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Values for "labels", "Labelled", "Label List", "Watches", "Watching" not updated in Contributors summary macro

fields.description:
h5. Summary

At present the statistics cover the following types of contributions:
# edits to the page(s)
# comments added to the page(s)
# labels added to the page(s)
# people watching the page(s)

h5. Suggestion
Add a separate statistic for displaying the number of likes in Contributors Summary Macro.
fields.summary: Ability to show page likes in Contributors Summary Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a page has existing tasks, if the [Task report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-task-report-macro/] points to it, it will display all the tasks from it. When the tasks are deleted from the target page, these will also be removed from the macro, as expected.

However, if the page is restored to a previous version (via the page history) that has the tasks, these will not be displayed on the Task Report macro anymore, even if the page is published again.

(i) Only newly added tasks will be retrieved in the macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page A and add some tasks to it.
# Create page B and [insert the Task Report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-task-report-macro/].
# On Page A, make sure to delete some or all the added tasks and publish them. Notice that the Task report will no longer show these tasks after a refresh on Page B.
# Go back to Page A and restore the version with the tasks via the ellipsis button at the top-right (...) > *Page history* > *Restore*.
# Refresh Page B and notice that the tasks are not displayed.

(i) Even if Page A or Page B get published again or the macro gets re-configured to show Page A again, the tasks won't be displayed.

h3. Expected Results

The tasks should be displayed on the Task Report macro.

h3. Actual Results

No tasks are displayed on the Task Report macro.

h3. Workaround

Manually copy, delete and, paste the tasks again. After that, publish the page and refresh the one with the Task Report macro.
fields.summary: Task report macro does not show restored tasks

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Although site-admins can bypass restrictions with the [Admin key feature for Confluence|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/bypass-access-restrictions-on-a-page-with-admin-key/], it requires interaction to be done, which avoids the user to know which pages are already restricted if the user does not start a session.

h3.Suggestion

For scenarios like legal discovery tools (such as a service account that is not able to interact with anything in the UI) or using the search of Confluence for sensitive content, it would be good if the site-admin could have a session with the admin key that would not time out nor need to be activated.

This is a suggestion to allow site admins to use a permanent session of the admin key to allow the content to be displayed mostly for legal purposes and sensitive data.
fields.summary: Permanent bypassing of restrictions with admin key

fields.description:
h3. Problem

After attaching two mp4 video files and reloading the page file preview shows the first file as an audio file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach two MP4 videos 
 # Publish the page
 # Reload the page

h3. Expected Results

Files preview should be shown normally, even after reloading the page.
h3. Actual Results

The first file preview is turned into audio. 
h3. Workaround
 # Embed externally hosted videos.
 # Convert the MP4 file to another format (.MOV, for example)
fields.summary: Issues when reproducing MP4 while embedding two files into a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachment macro does not Include Old Attachment Versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add attachment macro
 # Add an attachment
 # Again add the same attachment.

h3. Expected Results

Users can see the Old Attachment Versions

h3. Actual Results

Users not seeing the Old Attachment Versions

h3. Workaround

The old attachment version can be viewed on the attachment page.
fields.summary: Attachment Macro does not display Old Attachment Versions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on the "Browse for files" link on the Attachments macro does nothing

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Add the Attachments macro
 # Publish the page
 # Click on the "Browse for files" link

h3. Expected Results
A file explorer window would show up to select a file

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Workaround
Drag and drop the file to be uploaded
fields.summary: Clicking on the "Browse for files" link on the Attachments macro does nothing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When fetching a page through our Page Tree Creator Macro one of our customers is sometimes faced with following error:

"error\": \"Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Unable to acquire JDBC Connection\"

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-688671
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the site whitemilk.atlassian.net and create a new page in any space.
 # Use 'Page Tree Creator macro'. Publish the page.
 # Click on the macro button i.e. 'Create Page Tree'.
 # Enter any page under the space SALES
 # Click Submit.
 # The error will show up

h3. Expected Results

Page should load
h3. Actual Results

Jdbc exception
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

For now there is no workaround. Happening on a particular page
fields.summary: When fetching page JDBC Connection error which has PageTree Creator Macro

fields.description:
Currently, apps get added to the default user group, that may or may not be confluence-users group and thats how apps get permissions through this group. 
- If the default user group doesn't have space permissions, then the app wouldn't have permission to the space as well.
- From the UI, we couldnt actually add/remove apps from any groups. Apps simply dont show up in the group add members search.

(on) Hence, suggestion would be to add a separate group for apps so permissions can be managed.
fields.summary: Confluence should have separate app group to manage permissions.

fields.description: Is there a way to have Ironclad integrated into Confluence like Smartsheet?
fields.summary: Ironclad Integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to add labels to attachments in Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page with an attachment.
# Select *...* to open the list of attachments.
# On the *Labels column* click on the pencil to add a label.

h3. Expected Results

Users should have the option to add labels to the attachment.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when clicking on the edit button.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to add labels to attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a blog post macro is created, the "Maximum Number of Blog Posts" is by default set to 100. This number is confusing as it only takes 15 as effective. If any number other than 100 is displayed it works fine.
h3. Environment


 * Confluence Cloud
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create more than 15 blog posts in your site
 # Create a blog post macro
 # The "Maximum Number of Blog Posts" field by default has 100.
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

All the blog posts (maximum 100) should be displayed
h3. Actual Results

Only 15 blog posts are displayed
h3. Workaround

Change the number from 100 to any other number and it will display as expected.
fields.summary: Blog post Macro does not obey "Maximum Number of Blog Posts" as 100
